variants.HGVS: N.D. (As the literature doesn't provide detailed information for standardizing HGVS nomenclature, this field is filled as N.D.)

Material used.Material Name: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells, primary cultures of mesencephalic neurons, PC12 cell line
Material used.Description: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells were prepared from neonatal Wistar rats. Primary cultures of mesencephalic neurons were prepared from the mesencephali of mouse embryos at embryonic day 15. The PC12 cell line was maintained in RPMI medium supplemented with 10% horse serum and 5% FBS on collagen IV - coated plastic dishes.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (As the assay method doesn't have a direct readout related to the variant in a described way, this field is filled as N.D.)

Material used.Material Source: Multiple sources like ADDGENE, Evrogen, Clontech, SABiosciences, and gifts from researchers
Material used.Material Name: EGFP - LC3, mito - CFP, mito - KillerRed, GFP, mitochondrial - pDsRed2, plasmids expressing shRNA against Parkin, ATG12, and Beclin1, plasmids expressing WT α - synuclein and A53T α - synuclein, mRFP - GFP - LC3, WT Mfn2, dominant negative Drp1 K38A, EGFP - p62, APP Arc - Swe, SOD1 G93A, YFP - Parkin
Material used.Description: The plasmid expressing EGFP - LC3 (plasmid no. 11546) was obtained from ADDGENE, mito - CFP and mito - KillerRed from Evrogen, GFP and mitochondrial - pDsRed2 from Clontech. Plasmids expressing shRNA against Parkin, ATG12, and Beclin1 were from SABiosciences. The plasmids expressing WT α - synuclein and A53T α - synuclein were kind gifts from Dr. S. Ko ˜ks. mRFP - GFP - LC3 was a generous gift from Dr. E. Bampton, WT Mfn2 from Dr. S. Hirose and Dr. N. Nakamura, dominant negative Drp1 K38A from Dr. A. van der Bliek, EGFP - p62 from Dr. T. Johansen, APP Arc - Swe from Dr. C. Sahlin, SOD1 G93A from Dr. H. D. Durham, and YFP - Parkin from Dr. R. Youle.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (As the assay method doesn't have a direct readout related to the variant in a described way, this field is filled as N.D.)

Material used.Material Source: Cell cultures (neuronal cultures and PC12 cells)
Material used.Description: Cultures were transiently transfected on the 2nd day after plating with Lipofectamine TM 2000. Approximately 1 × 10 5 PC12 cells were seeded on glass - bottom dishes 12 - 24 h before the transfection.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (As the assay method doesn't have a direct readout related to the variant in a described way, this field is filled as N.D.)

Material used.Material Name: Neuronal cultures transfected with various plasmids
Material used.Description: For autophagy measurements, the neuronal cultures were transfected with EGFP - LC3 (or EGFP - LC3 - RFP), mito - pDsRed2, and the plasmids of interest. For mitochondrial density measurements in axons, the neuronal cultures were transfected with GFP, mito - pDsRed2, and the plasmids of interest. For mitochondrial density measurements in the cell body, 512 × 512 pixel sections were acquired from transfected cultures. For Parkin visualization experiments, PC12 cells or cortical neurons were transfected with YFP - Parkin, mito - CFP, and mito - KillerRed. For mitochondrial membrane potential visualization, the cultures were stained with TMRE.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (for measurements like number of autophagosomes, mitochondrial density, colocalization duration etc.)

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (As the assay method doesn't have a direct readout related to the variant in a described way, this field is filled as N.D.)
Readout description.Result Description: For autophagy measurements, the distribution and colocalization of GFP - LC3 punctates and pDsRed2 were analyzed. For mitochondrial density measurements in axons, the mitochondrial density was calculated as mitochondrial length per axonal length. For mitochondrial density in the cell body, the mitochondrial volume was divided by the cell body volume. For Parkin visualization, the translocation of Parkin was observed. For mitochondrial membrane potential visualization, the staining with TMRE was analyzed.

Material used.Description: The cells were lysed in a buffer containing 50 mM Tris - Cl, 1 mM EDTA, 150 mM NaCl, 1% Nonidet P - 40, 1 mM Na 3 VO 4 , 1 mM NaF, 0.25% sodium deoxycholate, and 4% protease inhibitor mixture.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (As the assay method doesn't have a direct readout related to the variant in a described way, this field is filled as N.D.)
Readout description.Result Description: Equivalent amounts of total protein were separated by SDS - PAGE, transferred to PVDF membranes, blocked, incubated with primary and secondary antibodies, and immunoreactive bands were detected by ECL and analyzed densitometrically.

Material used.Description: Neurons were co - transfected with a fusion protein that connected the yeast Gal4 DNA binding domain with full - length PGC - 1α, an appropriate Gal4 - UAS - luciferase reporter, A53T α - synuclein, and 0.1 μg of Renilla luciferase (pRL - CMV) plasmid.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (relative firefly luciferase luminescence normalized to Renilla luciferase signal)

Readout description.Variant: A53T α - synuclein (as the assay is related to this variant's effect on PGC - 1α activity)
Readout description.Conclusion: A53T α - synuclein increased Gal4 - PGC1α transcriptional activity by ∼80%
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Gain - of - function (in terms of increasing PGC - 1α transcriptional activity)
Readout description.Result Description: The luciferase assays were performed 24 h post - transfection using Dual - Glo Luciferase Assay reagent. PGC - 1α activity was determined as relative firefly luciferase luminescence normalized to the Renilla luciferase signal measured by a MicroBeta TriLux luminescence counter.

Biological replicates.Description: At least eight independent samples were analyzed per group.
